cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 410 miles ESE of Corpus Christi, TX
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the central Texas coast between Port Mansfield and San Luis Pass
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor-Matagorda Bay, TX (mid-Texas coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, TX (includes Corpus Christi area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas coast from Brownsville northward to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm winds 35–45 mph with higher gusts possible Friday night through Saturday near Corpus Christi.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge of 1–3 ft possible on the mid-Texas coast, especially at high tide; elevated surf and dangerous rip currents expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands of 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 10 inches could cause flash flooding and ponding at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions that will disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations.
